title: Justice Dept watchdog to probe Republican claims of FBI surveillance abuses
text:
Taxes Justice Dept watchdog to probe Republican claims of FBI surveillance abuses Michael Horowitz, inspector general of the U.S. Justice Department, said he is launching a review of the FBI and the Justice Department. The review will examine whether the FBI and the Justice Department followed proper procedures when they applied for a warrant to secretly conduct surveillance on Trump's former campaign adviser. Published 20 Mins Ago Tom Williams | CQ Roll Call | Getty Images Michael Horowitz, inspector general of the Justice Department 
The internal watchdog at the U.S. Justice Department said on Wednesday he is launching a review, after Republican members of the U.S. House Intelligence Committee alleged that the FBI made serious missteps when it sought a warrant to monitor a former advisor to President Donald Trump 's 2016 campaign. 
Michael Horowitz, the department's inspector general, said in a statement his review will examine whether the FBI and Justice Department followed the proper procedures, when they applied for a warrant with the Foreign Intelligence Surveillance Court to secretly conduct surveillance on Carter Page.
